kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
@msr
The main issue is a key difference between `dotnet run --project MyApp.csproj` and `dotnet MyApp.dll`.
`dotnet run` is [meant to be used with local source code](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-run#description) during development.
`dotnet` [runs compiled .NET applications](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet#description).
When you are doing a deployment, you want to use `dotnet MyApp.dll --kxp-cd-restore ...`
You can see this differentiation in [our documentation on updating Xperience by Kentico](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/installation/update-xperience-by-kentico-projects#update-process-overview).
> For deployed applications containing built assemblies, run the following `dotnet` command (replace the assembly with the name of your Xperience project’s DLL)
